The Carrington Event was the most intense geomagnetic storm in recorded history, peaking from 1 to 2 September 1859 during solar cycle 10. It created strong auroral displays that were reported globally[1] and caused sparking and even fires in multiple telegraph stations. The geomagnetic storm was most likely the result of a coronal mass ejection (CME) from the Sun colliding with Earth's magnetosphere.[2]
The geomagnetic storm was associated with a very bright solar flare on 1 September 1859. It was observed and recorded independently by British astronomers Richard Carrington and Richard Hodgson ‚Äì the first records of a solar flare.

The earth and it's atmosphere go through cyclical changes.  This is a fact.  The data hasn't be recorded long enough for anyone to say that what we are experiencing now has never happened before. 

At the same time man is polluting the environment more now then ever before.  We are using resources more than ever before.  Is this hurting our planet, the speculation (and it is) suggests yes.

There earth is finite, it doesn't grow in size; most for resources we consume have a finite limit.  So what has changed.  This is the elephant in the room that no one wants to admit.  The worlds population has grown exponentially.  Since tracking this before the 1900's is a guess at best, i will use the year 1927, est world pop. 2,000,000,000; in 2020 it was est at 7,794,798,739... the world population has quadrupled in just over 100 years.  More people means more consumption of resources and also more subsequent pollution.  Do fossil fuels pollute the earth, it appears so, but will switching even a substantial portion of the world to green vehicles stop or reverse the existing climate change, again speculation says yes.

There is a lot of speculation on climate change, very little scientific proof.  We do know is the earth can only support some many people and we are rapidly approaching that limit.  I'd suggest every digest that for a while before saying they have a solution.

Weather scientists, not the climate scientists hoaxsters, have proven that cosmic rays cause clouds affecting our weather greatly. The amount of cosmic rays hitting the earth waxes and wanes with the sun's magnetic field, and they can predict that field accurately, and thus they can predict future weather and therefore climate change.

They say we are going to freeze after 2030.
This is an 11 year cycle. Nothing new.

Scientists can guess the age of a star and predict how much longer it will live. But occasionally, a star will inexplicably begin to overheat, followed by a premature explosion and death. Our sun may be overheating prematurely. The whole climate change/global warming rhetoric is just a distraction from the scientific community and governments of the world to keep the population from panicking. It's a way to try to explain the changes in temperature and climate patterns that people have been noticing. If we are led to believe that these changes are man-caused, that gives us some sense of control, makes us believe that we can fix it. Those extra long and lingering "contrails" we've all noticed, but were too embarrassed to admit to noticing, were a way to buy us some time by putting up a reflective shield of aluminum, barium, or silver particles. That program was very expensive, so it was largely scaled back. We were all told that they were typical contrails, but those of us who have been around a while knew that they looked nothing like the contrails from our childhood. The program reached its highest point of activity during the Obama administration, and then those new types of  strange "contrails" seemed to magically disappear on January 20th 2016, and have only occasionally been seen since. Of course real contrails are still frequently seen; those short, quickly dissipating, vapor trails that follow jet aircraft.

Oh STOP with the 99% of scientists BS. It has been debunked thoroughly... where have you been, an Al Gore rally? Current data is important and we should pay attention, but we also should place it in context of Earth history and with other greenhouse events that are far greater in magnitude.... solar activity and volcanos for instance. The one near Tonga is a good example of recent "warming" and even "cooling" effects that far outweigh human activity. Insect farts, for goodness sake, outweigh the carbon footprint of man. Did you know that Earth has warmed (and then cooled) by far greater magnitude many times in history.... and all before human greenhouse activity. If you didn't know that, now you do. If you did know that, why do you arrogantly believe that anthropomorphic global warming is somehow a "fixable" threat?  It is far more likely that it isn't, and climate change is not "bad" in and of itself, it just is. If the Earth hadn't warmed and then cooled several times previously, you would not even be here. And our global starvation rates would be off the charts if we had the same climate today as we did in the 1500's.  Also please, for the love of God, keep in mind, all these scientist's funding depends on you believing in "fixable" climate change, of which there is almost no demonstrable evidence. So keep up the good work, their kids need braces and Al Gore needs jet fuel
